radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild atelectatic changes at the lung bases without pleural effusion. Gallbladder wall is thickened, irregular, edematous and progressively hyperenhancing. No gallbladder wall disruption or pericholecystic fluid. Cholelithiasis with a suspected 3 mm stone within the proximal cystic duct. No choledocholithiasis. Normal pancreatic appearance. Enlarged portacaval and porta hepatis lymph nodes likely reactive. No retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. No ascites. Osseous structures are unremarkable.
